description: I have tried most of the mp3 tagging tools I could find, including Kid3, Audio Tag Tool, EasyTAG, etc, all of which failed to be usable in various ways. Ex Falso works exactly how you expect it to and the UI is very nice.
summary: By far the best audio tagging tool in the software center

description: Great if you want to update tag lines, but no options for cover art are included.
summary: Great For Tags, No Cover Art

description:
Compared to other taggers on Linux, it's generally better. Compared to MP3tag for Windows, its still laking features. There's doesn't seem to be a way to pull info from a database (like Free.db or discogs). can't see the album art, can't seem to manipulate filenames (like Uppercase Titles) or track number manipulation (like leading 0). 
If you just want to update normal tags (like album, artist etc), then it does that well enough. Still looking for an ID tagger in Linux unfortunately.
Out of all the linux compatible mp3 taggers and renamers this is the fastest to use. I honestly love it and hope it never changes.
summary: A long time user, best in class

description: if that was possible I would have given 5 stars.
summary: no support for embedded images in the tag

description: Me permite cambiar el tag de fecha de mi musica
